page.title: 10DINGLE FARM _ STAFFING
page.content: Dingle Farm,{640 acres}has been owned by the{Colwill}family since 1905. They employ{3}tractor drivers,{2}pigmen,{1 cattle/sheep man,{4}women and{1}man for fruit plus the family. Part-time labour about{30}people for approx.{2 weeks. A normal week is{40 hours ie.five{8}hour days.The day begins at {7.30am.}and ends at{4.30pm.}with half hour breaks at{10am.}and{1pm.}The annual holiday is{three weeks}plus {bank holidays.}When the farm is busy they work overtime. The{busy}times of the year are{spring}when the planting is done and late{July}to the end of {October}when the crops are harvested. The pigmen are busy all year and the stockman is busy in winter. The farmer has a full day inspecting crops, organizing the men, arranging sales of produce and attending meetings, often in the evenings.
